Here is for modeling

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(readr)
library(ggplot2)
library(reshape2)
```

```{r read data01}
diabetes_data01 <- read_csv("data/Diabetes_012_data.csv")

diabetes_data01 <- 
  diabetes_data01 |>
  select(Diabetes_012,HighBP,HighChol, BMI, Smoker, 
         Sex,Income, Education, 
         PhysActivity, Fruits, Veggies)|>
         filter(Diabetes_012 == '2' | Diabetes_012 == '0') |>
  mutate(Diabetes_012=ifelse(Diabetes_012=="2","1",Diabetes_012))|>
  mutate(Diabetes_012=as.numeric(Diabetes_012))

diabetes_data01
```

#### Modeling with Logistic Regression

```{r}
model <- glm(Diabetes_012 ~ HighBP + HighChol + BMI + Smoker + Sex + Income + PhysActivity + Fruits + Veggies, data = diabetes_data01)
summary(model)

```
